course_description: The objective of this course is to introduce students to a variety of economic concepts that may prove useful in their business careers.  These concepts will be used to examine business problems at the level of the firm and current issues of importance to the US and world economies.  Roughly half the course is devoted to topics in applied microeconomics and half to macroeconomic topics.  The analytical tools covered in Bus. 501 are sufficient preparation for the course.  No mathematics beyond high school algebra is required.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the One-Year or Two-Year MBA program.
